table.name: mem
table.column: See under {QIch wab Ho'DoS:n} for the names of the Klingon consonants and vowels.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a device that receives (but does not send) an audio signal. For the device used for two-way communication, see {Se' HablI':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for a broadcaster, radio service, etc. It can also be used for the device that does the transmitting. If a distinction must be made, the device is {wab labwI' jan:n@@wab labwI':n, jan:n:1}.
Dies kann gleichzeitig der Radiosender an sich sein, oder auch das sendende Gerät. Um zu unterscheiden, ist das Gerät {wab labwI' jan:n@@wab labwI':n, jan:n:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: As a spelling convention, {wab Do:n:nolink} "speed of sound" is written as two words. When used as a measurement term ("Mach"), it is written as one word ({wabDo:n:nolink}). The pronunciation (and, for that matter, the meaning) is the same.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a more general meaning of {waH:v:2}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is a specialized meaning of {waH:v:1}. It means to try out food to see if it's been properly prepared or to determine if one likes it.[2]
Do not confuse this with {mum:v}, which means "taste" in the sense of perceiving flavors.

table.name: mem
table.column: vibrate, be in a state of vibration
This means to move in a fast repetitive way, like a guitar string.
Dies bedeutet sich sehr schnell hin und her bewegen, wie eine Gitarrensaite

table.name: mem
table.column: This is meat prepared with {ngat:n:2}. The word for the specific meat replaces the word {Ha'DIbaH:n:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This sounds like the Chinese word for "crooked" (彎).

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an Indo-European root "wanha" with exactly this meaning.

table.name: mem
table.column: To express natural phenomena, the name for the effect is followed by the word {wanI':n:nolink}.[2]
This word was defined in {TKD:src} as "phenomenon, event, occurrence". The definition "effect" was added in the booklet for the {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2016:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: You can certainly "wack" someone with it, or "walk" in it.

table.name: mem
table.column: en slags fågel (med en väldigt lång näbb)
This is a bird with a very long beak.
Kiwi is a brand of shoe polish ({waq:n} "shoe", {boch:v} "be shiny"), and also a kind of bird with a very long beak.

table.name: mem
table.column: ستون (در یک جدول یا صفحه گسترده) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
kolumn (i en tabell eller ett kalkylblad) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
列（在表格或電子表格中） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
From the term "warp and weft" in weaving. See also {wev:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: type of knife (used for food preparation)
نوع چاقو (برای تهیه غذا استفاده می شود) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
刀的類型（用於食物準備） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is large, sharp, and square-bladed, almost like an {'obmaQ:n}.
This is a reference to Ward and June Cleaver, from the television show "Leave It to Beaver". See {tlher:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that this means "be amiss, awry" (something has gone wrong or didn't turn out according to plan), as opposed to {muj:v} "be incorrect, factually wrong".

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: For the mathematical operation of division, see {boqHa''egh:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: "The White Stripes" was an American rock band.

table.name: mem
table.column: We succeed together in a greater whole.
Wir haben Erfolg als Teile eines großen Ganzen.
ما در کل بزرگتر می شویم [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Vi lyckas tillsammans i en större helhet. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
我們在更大的整體上共同取得成功。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Konzentriere dich auf ein einziges Ziel.

table.name: mem
table.column: This literally means "we hit one target". It can be shortened to just {DoS wIqIp.:sen:nolink}

table.name: mem
table.column: wa' jaj 'etlh 'uchchoHlaH tlhIngan puqloD; jajvetlh loD nen moj.
The son of a Klingon is a man the day he can first hold a blade.
Der Sohn eines Klingonen ist ein Mann sobald er ein Schwert halten kann.
پسر کلینگان روزی است که او می تواند اولین تیغه را نگه دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Klingons son är en man dagen han först kan hålla ett blad. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
克林崗的兒子是他可以先拿刀片的那一天。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: For one mission, there is one leader.
Für eine Mission gibt es einen Führer.
برای یک ماموریت، یک رهبر وجود دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
För ett uppdrag finns en ledare. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
對於一個任務，有一個領導者。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: wa' SuvwI' muHlu'DI', tuHchoH Hoch SuvwI'pu'.
The execution of but one warrior brings shame to all.
Die Hinrichtung eines einzigen Kriegers bringt Schande über alle.
اعدام اما یکی از جنگجویان همه را شرمنده می کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Utförandet av en enda krigare ger skam till alla. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
只有一個戰士的執行給所有人帶來了恥辱。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Maltz said that if, in school, a student responded to a teacher's question by saying this, the student was likely to be disciplined (unless that was actually the correct answer). He didn't elaborate further.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Kill one of them. I don't care which.
یکی از آنها را بکشید من اهمیتی نمی دهم که [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Döda en av dem. Jag bryr mig inte om vilken. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
殺掉其中一個。我不在乎哪個。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: In {Klingon Monopoly:src}, {Quj wa'DIch:n:nolink} is used to refer to the original Monopoly game. So {wa'DIch:n:nolink} can be used for "original" in the sense of "the first" (see under {qa':v} for the sentence).

table.name: mem
table.column: wa'maH cha' pemmey wa'maH cha' rammey je

This idiomatic expression refers to an event in the life of {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name}, when he fought his brother {moratlh:n:name} for twelve days and twelve nights (as recounted in the {paq'batlh:src}). The expression means not only that the length of the event is long, but also that the event is an important one, worthy of taking up so much time.

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingons consider the number 13 to be special because of the way they used to count. The decimal number 12 used to be expressed as 3 × 3 + 3, and then the system became complicated. This association remained even after Klingons switched over to the decimal number system.
▶ {qatlh Suvbe' chaH? wa'maH wej.:sen:nolink} "Why aren't they fighting? It's complicated."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: According to {The Klingon Art of War:src}, this is the name of the first Klingon god.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: vara i onåd, vara oönskad, vara utstött

table.name: mem
table.column: serve fermented food at its peak
vergorene/vergärte Lebensmittel zum richtigen Zeitpunkt servieren
غذای غنی شده را در اوج خود قرار دهید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
servera jäst mat när den är som bäst
在高峰期供應發酵食品 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is food mixed with {'atlhqam:n}, fermented, and served.[1, p.92]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is like {yot:v}, but with the connotation of surprise or speed.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: A warrior fights to the death.
Ein Krieger kämpft bis zum Tod.
یک جنگجو به مرگ می پیوندد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: جذاب (فقط به طرز عجیب و غریب) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
charmerande, just snyggt, vackert (används endast ironiskt)

table.name: mem
table.column: Either the thing owed, or the person to whom something is owed, can be the object.
In English slang, to "welch" is to fail to pay a debt or to fulfill an obligation.

▶ {qawel:sen:nolink} "I owe you"[1; 3] ▶ {voHDajbo' wellu' 100:sen:nolink} "mortgaged for 100"[2] ▶ {yervamvaD voHDajbo' wellu'chugh, 'echletHom Dopvam yIcha'.:sen:nolink} "Card must be turned this side up if property is mortgaged."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The stereotypical {targh:n:nolink} makes a sound conventionally rendered {welwelwel:sen:nolink} (where the number of repetitions is variable).
Der typische {targh:n:nolink} macht ein Geräusch, das man meist als {welwelwel:sen:nolink} nachmacht (Die Häufigkeit der Silbe ist variabel).

table.name: mem
table.column: kränka, bryta emot, överträda, störa, skända

table.name: mem
table.column: This word has this meaning in the {voSpegh Sep:n} dialect.

table.name: mem
table.column: ضربه (ابزار کوبه ای) با کف دست [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the closest thing Klingons have to the "World Wide Web".

table.name: mem
table.column: lose, undergo a reduction of, suffer a reduction of
از دست دادن، کاهش، رنج می برند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
förlora, genomgå en minskning av, drabbas av en minskning av [AUTOTRANSLATED]

To say that someone has died, just use {Hegh:v}. Using {weS:v:nolink} implies that someone is lost, i.e., gone or missing, or severely injured and not expected to return (or to return anytime soon), but not necessarily dead.

table.name: mem
table.column: ردیف (در یک جدول یا صفحه گسترده) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
rad (i en tabell eller ett kalkylblad) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
行（在表格或電子表格中） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
From the term "warp and weft" in weaving. See also {war:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a ship's full complement of personnel, crew plus officers.

table.name: mem
table.column:
{maH:n:1h}:{ghaH:n}/{'oH:n} = {wI-:v:pref,nolink}
When used with {-lu':v}, this prefix means "Someone (indefinite subject) does something to us".

table.name: mem
table.column: be sour, be bitter, be tart
vara sur, vara bitter, vara besk, vara syrlig
быть кислым, быть горьким, быть терпким
▶ {Hoch vor Dargh wIb.:sen:nolink} "Sour tea cures everything."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {qaStaHvIS wa'maH puq poHmey, wo'rIv betleH ghaj qorDu'Daj. nuja' tlhIngan wIch ja'wI'pu' yIntaHvIS qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay' batlh 'etlhvam chenmoHlu'pu'.:sen:nolink} "Worf's bat'telh has been in his family for ten generations. According to Klingon legend, this sword of honor descends from the time of Kahless the Unforgettable."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The example sentence is a lip-match for {'ej DochmeywIj vItlhapqa'meH}.
▶ {'ej Dojmey wID, vInDa'ma' peq.} "He has killed many of our people."

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {wIH; Hur'Iqngan rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an expression used between close friends in the higher social classes. It should be avoided if possible, unless one's social standing is absolutely clear.

The real reason {wIj jup:sen:nolink} has this meaning is because some Star Trek writer looked up "my" and "friend" in {TKD:src}, found {-wIj:n} and {jup:n}, and attached them to each other without any regard for grammar or correctness. In standard Klingon, "my friend" (assuming said friend is a being capable of language) is {jupwI':n:nolink} (from {jup:n} and {-wI':n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a stand-alone spike such as a stake.
On the TV show "Buffy the Vampire Slayer", there is a character nicknamed Spike whose real name is William.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a double pun: it sounds like "will puke", and also refers to "Pudd'nhead Wilson" ({puqloD:n} means "son"), the name of the eponymous character of a Mark Twain novel.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a famous Klingon playwright.

table.name: mem
table.column: According to {KGT p.99:src}, this verb may be used to describe the action of breaking off a portion of food to transfer from a serving platter ({'elpI':n}) to one's plate ({jengva':n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is also used for clicking on a hyperlink on a computer.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to an abstract schematic of a battlefield, which is displayed on a {jIH:n:2}. Contrast this with {HaSta:n}.
The first ever line of Klingon spoken on-screen was {wIy cha':sen@@wIy:n, cha':v}, in {Star Trek I:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: صفحه نمایش تاکتیکی را نمایش دهید! [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Watch Gowron say this: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/ooFuTPjRtEM}
The clipped Klingon form of this command would be {wIy cha'!:sen@@wIy:n, cha':v}
The first ever line of Klingon spoken on-screen was {wIy cha':sen:nolink}, in {Star Trek I:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is not a Klingon word, but the Klingon pronunciation of a Federation Standard word, referring to a collaboratively edited website or database.

table.name: mem
table.column: hurl a spear by means of a {chetvI':n:2}

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {cha' 'ujmo' jIH woch law' SoH woch puS:sen:nolink} "I'm two {'uj:sen:nolink}es taller than you."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: It is regrettable when this is applied to food.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: transgress, do more than is acceptable
فرار، انجام بیش از قابل قبول است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
överträda, göra mer än vad som är acceptabelt, gå för långt
{bIwogh:sen:nolink} might be translated "You go too far."

table.name: mem
table.column: ta upp, plocka upp, lyfta upp

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {labmeH 'evnagh Se' lo' tlhIngan QumwI'. janmey ngo' lulo'lu'DI' pIj jabbI'ID nISpu' woj.:sen:nolink} "A Klingon communicator sends a signal through subspace radio. Older models were susceptible to radiation."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The noun {woj:n} and the verb {Say'qu'moH:v} appeared next to each other in a word list published in {veS QonoS:src} (reprinted in {HQ 1.3, Sept. 1992:src} in Sept. 1992). Will Martin made an error in transcribing the words, and MO subsequently canonised his error, as a joke.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is used for both eating and attacking by pecking.

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that {'ol:v} is used for checking a fact, while {woq:v:nolink} is used for confirming it.
[1] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}, [2] {DSC - Magic to Make the Sanest Man Go Mad:src}

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {wov; ghI'boj Sech rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Watch the Hallmark commercial in which this word appears: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/9eM1OSNGLwI}
This word has appeared in canon only in the formation {wovmoHbogh janHommey:n:nolink}[1; 2], but the noun suffixes have been removed here for ease of reference.
▶ {Qapqu' wovmoHbogh janHommey!:sen:nolink} "It even has working lights!"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to specific memories or recollections, and is different from "memory" in the sense of the ability to remember or the power of recall, for which see {qaw:n}.
▶ {wov'on qaw:sen@@wov'on:n, qaw:v} "he/she remembers a memory", "he/she has a memory"

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: {wo' tay':n:nolink} is an older name than {tuqjIjQa':n}. The Klingons who gave the country this name might have been thinking of the British Empire.[2]
[1] {Radio Times Star Trek 30th Anniversary Special Issue:src}, [2] {KLI mailing list 2011.10.29:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: wo' toy'taHvIS Hegh 'e' tul Hoch tlhIngan.
To die while serving the Empire is the hope of every Klingon.
Im Dienste des Imperiums zu sterben ist die Hoffnung jedes Klingonen.
در حالی که خدمت امپراتوری را می کشند امید هر کلینگان است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Att dö medan du tjänar imperiet är hoppet på varje Klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
服務帝國時死亡是每個克林崗人的希望。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The son of Mogh ({mogh:n:name}), and the first Klingon officer to serve in Starfleet. He is portrayed by the actor {mayqel Do'rIn:n:name}.

table.name: mem
table.column: An idiomatic way of saying "snore" in English is "saw wood".

table.name: mem
table.column: محافظت نشده باشد، آسیب پذیر باشد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara oskyddad, vara sårbar, vara utsatt

▶ {Dumer DIvI' QaS 'ej DuHIv, vaj bIwunchoH 'ej bIrIQchoH.:sen:nolink} "Surprise attack by Federation leaves you unprotected and damaged."[1] ▶ {DuHIv jagh Dangu'laHbe'bogh, vaj bIwunchoH 'ej bIpujchoH.:sen:nolink} "Attack by unknown enemy leaves you vulnerable and weak."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to undo a decision. Its only known use in canon is in the example.

table.name: mem
table.column: ha huvudvärk, ha ont i huvudet
The similarity of this to {wuq:v} may be a joke.

table.name: mem
table.column: förlita sig på, vara beroende av, vara hänvisad till
